alert.note: Alert for Ventura County Beaches (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Beach Hazards Statement issued September 25 at 12:58PM PDT until September 28 at 9:00PM PDT by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT IN EFFECT FROM 9 PM PDT THIS EVENING THROUGH THURSDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Dangerous rip currents and breaking waves of 4 to 6 feet with local sets to 7 are possible due to elevated surf expected. * WHERE...Ventura County Beaches, especially west and northwest facing beaches. * WHEN...From 9 PM PDT this evening through Thursday evening. * IMPACTS...There is an increased risk of ocean drowning. Rip currents can pull swimmers and surfers out to sea. Waves can wash people off beaches and rocks, and capsize small boats nearshore. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Nuisance coastal flooding and minor beach erosion may occur Tuesday evening.
info.instruction: Remain out of the water due to hazardous swimming conditions, or stay near occupied lifeguard towers. Rock jetties can be deadly in such conditions, stay off the rocks.
